entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued June 02 at 6:00AM AKDT until June 02 at 9:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES, LOW HUMIDITY, AND BREEZY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 025... The National Weather Service in Juneau has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 9 PM AKDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Pickens, northern Greene and north central Sumter Counties through 115 PM CDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:21AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WILDFIRE POTENTIAL FOR WESTERN UPPER MICHIGAN DUE TO A COMBINATION OF GUSTY WINDS, DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS... Southwest winds gradually become westerly by this afternoon with very deep mixing up to 12 kft expected. As a result, min RH values in the low to mid 20s and westerly gusts of 20-25 mph are expected this afternoon. Scattered showers and isolated thunderstorms

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 02 at 10:33AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Clark Fork and Bitterroot Rivers are expected to rise to near minor flood stage early next week... Timing of the event - Sunday into Tuesday Snowmelt combined with precipitation Saturday into Tuesday next week, will increase river flows on the Clark Fork and Bitterroot Rivers. The Clark Fork above Missoula is forecast to

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 01 at 12:13PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bitterroot River in Ravalli County is expected to rise to near minor flood stage early next week... Timing of the event - Monday-Tuesday Snowmelt combined with expected precipitation this week and the weekend, will increase river flows along the Bitterroot River in Ravalli County early next week. The river at Bell Crossing near

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 31 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Runoff has begun, with significant rises on area streams... Area streams have risen the last day or two from significant precipitation that occurred last weekend. This included two to four inches of precipitation in the foothills, and one to three feet of heavy wet snowfall in the higher elevations of the mountains. The newer snow may be ripe to quickly melt off with warmer temperatures

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:34PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN BRADLEY... SOUTHWESTERN MEIGS AND MCMINN COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However gusty winds are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 31 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Runoff has begun, with significant rises on area streams... Area streams have risen the last day or two from significant precipitation that occurred last weekend. This included two to four inches of precipitation in the foothills, and one to three feet of heavy wet snowfall in the higher elevations of the mountains. The newer snow may be ripe to quickly melt off with warmer temperatures
